fields.professional:
* Oct 2006, Jan 2007 Lectured at Antioch University on Depression and Natural Health
        * Featured writer in the August and December issues of SB Fitness Magazine and November issue of Massage Magazine
        * Featured in articles in Massage Magazine, SB Fitness Magazine, Different Strokes, Pacific Coast Business Times and Dermascope Magazine.
        * Selected by Massage Magazine as a "Best Practice" for 2006 and 2007
        * Licensed for massage therapy in SB County and Cities of SB and Goleta.
        * Member of Associated Bodywork Massage Professionals, American Naturopath Medical Association, Women's Economic Ventures and Central Coast Doula Assoc.
fields.personal_interests: I enjoy reading, teaching, writing, theatre, improv and my 3 cats.
fields.employment:
Private Massage Practice, 2001-present

    SANTA BARBARA, CA (formerly in Los Angeles, CA 1995-1999)

    Work with individuals (22-26/week) in a therapeutic setting for recovery from injuries/stress. Close work with local chiropractors for continuity of care. Use techniques including deep tissue, trigger point, acupressure, magnets, aromatherapy and Reiki. Currently employ 3 therapists as independent contractors.

    Selected as a "Best Practice" by Massage Magazine for 2006 AND 2007

    Santa Barbara Business College, September 2007 - present

   SANTA BARBARA, CA

    Instructor for Pathology for Massage and Nutrition for Fitness. Tasks involve lecture, class planning, grading, exam design and research.

    Massage Therapist/Chiropractic Assistant, 2001-2003

    DR'S CRAVIOTTO, DAWSON AND WAGNER, DC's

    Work closely with chiropractors on treatment of their patients. Use primarily deep tissue and trigger point work. Active charting with SOAP notes and doctor conferences.

    Massage Therapist/Physical Therapy Aide, 2001

    SANTA BARBARA INDUSTRIAL MEDICAL CENTER, PHYSICAL THERAPY DEPARTMENT

    Promote healing of pre and post op patients with various work-related injuries including low back strain, carpal tunnel, tendonitis, and knee and shoulder problems. Work directly with physicians, communication using SOAP notes. Utilize a variety of therapeutic options: massage, e-stim, heat packs, ice massage, stretching and weight training, ultrasound and paraffin dips. Typically see patients from onset of diagnosis through to discharge.
fields.training_and_education:
2007 Energetic Kinesiology and Muscle Testing Nutritive Reflex Technique 8 hours w. Dr. Lasneski. Learn about the emotional, genetic, environmental, nutritive, structural and dysbiotic cause of losing health and how one can effect change.

    2007 American Naturopath Medical Association Convention 26 hours of lecture on various topics such as Cell Healing, Nutrition, Whole Foods, Minerals, Iridology, Detoxification, Children's Nutrition, Natural Pain Relief, Hormones, Emotional Medicine, Heart Disease, and Color Healing. With special workshops in Probiotics, Energy Balancing, Pain Relief and Intestinal Disorders.

    2007-Current Clayton College of Natural Health. Enrolled in the MS in Natural Health and PhD in Natural Health. Curriculum includes Nutrition, Biology, Cancer Treatment, Anatomy, Holistic Development, Traditional Chinese Medicine, Ayurvedic Medicine, Mind/Body Wellness and Research and Dissertation. Expected 2010 graduation with MS and PhD.

    2006-2007 Clayton College of Natural Health Doctor of Naturopathy for Health Care Professionals. Highest Honors. Curriculum included Herbology, Iridology, Homeopathy, Diet, Cleansing and Nutrition, Mind-body medicine, Practicum and Assessment techniques.

    2007 Healing And the Childbearing Year Central Coast Doula Association Conference featuring Penny Simkin. Childhood Sexual Abuse and its effect on childbearing, Postpartum care, Infant care, Healing Remedies for the childbearing year.

    2007 Dr's Gaby and Wright Nutrition and Disease Lecture 4 day lecture addressing every vitamin, mineral, enzyme and amino acid and information on nutrition for over 300 diseases and disorders.

    2006 American Naturopath Medical Association Convention 26 hours of lecture on various topics such as Nutrition, Mind-body medicine, Herbs, Chinese Medicine, Breath work, Homeopathics, Cancer, Depression and Diabetes education.

    2006 Clayton College of Natural Health Certificate of Natural Wellness Highest Honors, Curriculum included Nutrition, Mind-Body Medicine, Alternative Practices, Holistic Lifestyles, and Energy Techniques.

    2004-2005 Stratford Career Institute Natural Health Consultant Program, Honors, Curriculum included Herbs, Homeopathy, Smoking Cessation, Diet, Exercise, Health Counseling and Digestive Health Issues.

    2003 LMTSuccessGroup, 45 hour program Medical Massage Certification with training in Postural Distortion, Back Conditions, Cervical Conditions, Arm and Leg Disorders, Insurance Billing and Healing with E-Stim.

    2001 SB School of Massage 200 hour program Training and Certification with training in Swedish, Sports, Shiatsu, On-site Chair, Chiropractic Massage, Pregnancy, Myofascial Release, Deep Tissue, Polarity Balancing, Anatomy and Ethics and Business.

    1995 School of Massage, Encino, CA. Training and Certification 75 hour program with training in Swedish, Deep Tissue, Anatomy and Ethics.

    1990 3 years Private Study with Pat Mauro, LMT, RN, EMT; Pittsburgh, PA. Training in Deep Tissue, Body Manipulation, Herbs, and Intuitive Massage

    1988-1992 Point Park University, Pittsburgh, PA BFA theatre, Minor in Psychology, graduated Cum Laude

    Reiki Certification to Master Level with Diane Vaughn RM, Venice, CA.

    I have taught group as well as individual classes and perform healings and attunements.

    Further/Self-Study in Pet Massage, Sports Massage, Myofascial Release, Polarity Therapy, Lymphatic Drainage and Acupressure/Trigger Point, Mind/Body Healing, Magnetics, Anatomy, pH, Assessment and Palpation Techniques.
